oncogenic rearrangement of EWS to produce EWS/Fli-1 may enhance the antiapoptotic effect of Brn-3a and inhibit its ability to promote neuronal differentiation.
First time 2 different EWS fusion transcripts found in same patient. It may be EWS translocations are not first step in Ewing's sarcoma

variation in overall gene expression patterns downstream of EWS-FLIl was observed, but also differential regulation of directly EWS-FLI1-bound genes

In mesenchymal stem cells EWS/FLI1 changed morphology from a mesenchymal spindle shape to a small round-to-polygonal cell, downregulated mesenchyme-positive markers CD10 & CD13 and the upregulated Ewing's family tumor markers CD54, CD99, CD117, & CD271.

role of EWS/LI1 as an inhibitor of cellular senescence implicating the retinoblastoma family of proteins as key mediators of this inhibition

temporally and spatially regulated functions of the EWS protein and, particularly, into its role in the regulation of the cell cycle and possibly cell differentiation.

Propsectively evaluated the impact of EWS-FLI1/ERG fusions on disease progression in Ewing's sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor.

these findings suggest that, besides directly controlling the activity of its primary target promoters, EWS-FLI1 can also indirectly influence gene expression in tumor cells by modulating the activity of key transcription factors such as NFkappaB.
an examination of soft tissue myoepithelial tumors found chromosomal translocations involving EWSR1 in 45% of the cases irrespective of grade of tumor.
these results suggest that suppression of FOXO1 function by EWS-Fli1 fusion protein may contribute to cellular transformation in Ewing's family tumors.
This is the first description of a fusion between EWSR1 and a chromatin-reorganizing gene in Ewing sarcoma/PNET.
Tumors associated with EWSR1 translocation are not uniformly more common in people of European ancestry. The relationship between race and EWSR1 somatic translocation is complex.

study identified three missense variants in EWSR1 in ALS patients, which were absent in a large number of healthy control individuals. We show that disease-specific variants affect EWSR1 localization in motor neurons.

name: EWS RNA binding protein 1

kegg.name: Transcriptional misregulation in cancer - Homo sapiens (human)

summary: This gene encodes a multifunctional protein that is involved in various cellular processes, including gene expression, cell signaling, and RNA processing and transport. The protein includes an N-terminal transcriptional activation domain and a C-terminal RNA-binding domain. Chromosomal translocations between this gene and various genes encoding transcription factors result in the production of chimeric proteins that are involved in tumorigenesis. These chimeric proteins usually consist of the N-terminal transcriptional activation domain of this protein fused to the C-terminal DNA-binding domain of the transcription factor protein. Mutations in this gene, specifically a t(11;22)(q24;q12) translocation, are known to cause Ewing sarcoma as well as neuroectodermal and various other tumors. Alternative splicing of this gene results in multiple transcript variants. Related pseudogenes have been identified on chromosomes 1 and 14. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2009].
